title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message: So I have an 820-3437 drawing .100A and is missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD.  PP5V_S4RS3 is missing, in fact , it seems I am missing all 4 PGOOD signals. No sign of liquid damage.

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message:
You can't look at ALL_SYS_PWRGD when missing S3 voltages.
It requires sum of several S5, S3 and even S0 voltages.

3V3_S5/SUS stable?
Did you try SMC bypass mode?
Are you using original Magsafe 2 charger?

Post PM_BATLOW_L, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWVRMEN and all RTC signals.

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message:
3V3S5/SUS is a Stable 3.3V
PM_BATLOW_L: 3.3V
PS_DSW_PWRGD: 3.3V
PCH_DSWVRMEN: 3.2V
PPVRTC_G3H: 3.3V
RTC_RESET_L: 3.3V
PCH_INTERVRMEN: 3.2V
PCH_INTRUDER_L: 3.03V
PCH_SRTCRST_L: 3.3V

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message: Using original MS2

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message:
Post now PM_PWRBTN_L, SMC_ONOFF_L  and PM_RSMRST_L.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message: So PP3V42 was shorted to GND. found that the SMC was causing it so I replaced it. When I fired it up it was drawing 500mA and fan spin. I turned it off and put the board back in to the chassis, turned it on and now it is drawing 23mA but I have an orange light. I swear this board is possessed...

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message: Had to replace U1950. Board working now

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message: Nevermind, this is the wrong board, this one still not working

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message:
PM_PWRBTN_L: 3.3v
SMC_ONOFF_L :3.3v
PM_RSMRST_L: 3.4V

when I trigger SMC_ONOFF_L, PM_PWRBTN_L drops then recovers

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message: Check if all PM_SLP_Sx_L signals pulse at same time.

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message: This one is solved. Was ALL_SYS_PWRGD IC.

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message:
And which is that chip???
ALL_SYS_PWRGD connects with a lot of ICs.
And it comes from PM_SLP_S3_L, through R8167.
The other chips and resistors can only pull it down to ground...

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message: Oh ok. The one I replaced was Q8150

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message: I found that by measuring all of the rails required to get ALL_SYS_PWRGD and found none were missing.

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message: So all of S0 were present

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message: Probably not the best way, but I have a working LB.

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message: And I looked at the data sheet for that IC, pin 4 is the "ouput" pin.

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message: Wait, wrong one.

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message: Sorry, but anyway, you get the point

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message: Ok I get it, PM_SLP_S3_L goes through R8178, becomes PM_SLP_S3_R_L to U8180, then becomes PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L

title: 820-3437 Missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD
message:
You can remove Q8150 and throw it, not really needed.
If board works then, you can leave it as is; or find what is wrong on Q8150 inputs.
